016package app.supernaut.fx;
017
018import javafx.application.Application;
019import javafx.stage.Stage;
020import app.supernaut.ForegroundApp;
021
022import java.util.Optional;
023
024/**
025 * <b>Supernaut.fx</b> specialization of <b>Supernaut</b> {@link ForegroundApp}. Supernaut.fx {@link FxForegroundApp}s
026 * implement this interface instead of subclassing <b>OpenJFX</b> {@link Application}. This has several
027 * advantages over directly extending {@link javafx.application.Application}:
028 * <ol>
029 *     <li>
030 *       Applications {@code implement} an {@code interface} rather than {@code extend} a {@code class}.
031 *       This increases the testability and architectural flexibility of the application.
032 *     </li>
033 *     <li>
034 *         Abstracts {@link Stage} with {@link FxMainView}. This also helps with testing.
035 *     </li>
036 *     <li>
037 *         Supports faster, multi-threaded launching with {@link FxLauncherAbstract}.
038 *     </li>
039 *     <li>
040 *         Supports flexible construction of application object hierarchies with {@link FxLauncherAbstract} and
041 *         the {@link FxLauncherAbstract.AppFactory} interface, including Dependency Injection with <b>Micronaut</b>
042 *         and possibly other DI frameworks in the future.
043 *     </li>
044 * </ol>
045 * 
046 * Summary: Implement the {@link FxForegroundApp} interface instead of subclassing OpenJFX {@link Application}. Your
047 * apps will be faster and looser, but also tight. You can freely use and abuse inheritance as you please. You also
048 * can get your constructor injected, which is always fun.
049 */
050public interface FxForegroundApp extends ForegroundApp {
051    /**
052     * The application initialization method. This method is called from the JavaFX
053     * init() method after the dependency injection context is initialized and the
054     * application is constructed and dependency injected.
055     *
056     * <p>
057     * NOTE: This method is not called on the JavaFX Application Thread. An
058     * application must not construct a Scene or a Stage in this
059     * method.
060     * An application may construct other JavaFX objects in this method.
061     * </p>
062     * @throws java.lang.Exception if something goes wrong
063     */
064    @Override
065    default void init() throws Exception {};
066
067    /**
068     * Adapt from OpenJFX-independent {@link ForegroundApp} to JFX-compatible {@link FxForegroundApp}
069     * which requires a primary {@link Stage} to start.
070     * 
071     * @param mainView Must be a {@link FxMainView}
072     * @throws Exception if something goes wrong
073     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if mainView isn't a {@link FxMainView}
074     */
075    @Override
076    default void start(SupernautMainView mainView) throws Exception {
077        if (mainView instanceof FxMainView) {
078            start(mainView);
079        } else {
080            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Main view must be implementation of " + FxMainView.class);
081        }
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * The main entry point for Supernaut.fx applications. Called from the OpenJFX
086     * start() method.  At a minimum, you must implement this method.
087     *
088     * <p>
089     * NOTE: This method is called on the JavaFX Application Thread.
090     * </p>
091     *
092     * @param mainView A wrapper view containing the primary {@link Stage}
093     * @throws java.lang.Exception if something goes wrong
094     */
095    void start(FxMainView mainView) throws Exception;
096    
097    /**
098     * This method is called when the application should stop, and provides a
099     * convenient place to prepare for application exit and destroy resources.
100     *
101     * <p>
102     * NOTE: This method is called on the JavaFX Application Thread.
103     * </p>
104     * @throws java.lang.Exception if something goes wrong
105     */
106    @Override
107    default void stop() throws Exception {};
108
109    /**
110     * A OpenJfx-compatible {@link SupernautMainView} that potentially contains a {@link Stage}.
111     * We are trying to make having a {@link Stage} optional, because in test environments (and perhaps <b>macOS</b> apps
112     * if someday OpenJFX gets better <b>macOS</b> support) the Stage may not be present.
113     */
114    interface FxMainView extends SupernautMainView {
115        /**
116         * Show the stage/view
117         */
118        void show();
119
120        /**
121         * @return The {@link Stage} this view is contained in (if any)
122         */
123        Optional<Stage> optionalStage();
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * This interface makes converting from an instance of {@link Application} easier.
128     * <p>Simply change</p>
129     * <p>{@code class MyFXForegroundApp extends Application}</p>
130     * <p>to</p>
131     * <p>{@code class MyFXForegroundApp implements FxApplicationCompat}</p>
132     */
133    interface FxApplicationCompat extends FxForegroundApp {
134        /**
135         * Start method compatible with OpenJFX start method
136         *
137         * @param primaryStage primary stage (unwrapped)
138         */
139        void start(Stage primaryStage);
140        default void start(FxMainView mainView) {
141            start(mainView.optionalStage().orElseThrow());
142        }
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * Implement this interface if you need access to the {@link Application} object instance
147     */
148    interface OpenJfxApplicationAware extends ForegroundApp {
149        /**
150         * Setter that will receive the {@link Application} instance
151         * @param application reference to the OpenJFX application
152         */
153        void setJfxApplication(Application application);
154    }
155}
